                                    January 5, 2011

       Introduced  by M. of A. ORTIZ, LANCMAN -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A.
         BOYLAND, GALEF, MAYERSOHN, PERRY, REILLY, ROBINSON --  read  once  and
         referred to the Committee on Health

       AN ACT to amend the public health law and the education law, in relation
         to full and good faith participation in peer review activities

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivisions 1 and 2 of section 2805-m of the public health
    2  law, as amended by chapter 808 of the laws of 1987, are amended to  read
    3  as follows:
    4    1. The information required to be collected and maintained pursuant to
    5  [sections  twenty-eight hundred five-j and] SECTION twenty-eight hundred
    6  five-k of this article, reports required to  be  submitted  pursuant  to
    7  section  twenty-eight  hundred  five-l  of this article and any incident
    8  reporting requirements imposed upon  diagnostic  and  treatment  centers
    9  pursuant  to  the  provisions of this chapter shall be kept confidential
   10  and shall not be released except to the department or pursuant to subdi-
   11  vision four of section twenty-eight hundred five-k of this article.
   12    2. Notwithstanding any other provisions of law, none of  the  records,
   13  documentation  or  committee  actions  or  records  required pursuant to
   14  [sections twenty-eight hundred five-j and] SECTION twenty-eight  hundred
   15  five-k  of  this article, the reports required pursuant to section twen-
   16  ty-eight hundred five-l of  this  article  nor  any  incident  reporting
   17  requirements  imposed  upon diagnostic and treatment centers pursuant to
   18  the provisions of this chapter shall  be  subject  to  disclosure  under
   19  article  six  of  the  public  officers law or article thirty-one of the
   20  civil practice law and rules,  except  as  hereinafter  provided  or  as
   21  provided  by  any  other  provision of law. No person in attendance at a
   22  meeting of any such committee shall be required to testify  as  to  what
   23  transpired  thereat.  The prohibition relating to discovery of testimony

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.

       A. 1065                             2

    1  shall not apply to the statements made by any person  in  attendance  at
    2  such  a  meeting  who  is a party to an action or proceeding the subject
    3  matter of which was reviewed at such meeting.
    4    S  2.  Section  6530  of  the education law is amended by adding a new
    5  subdivision 50 to read as follows:
    6    50. FAILURE TO FULLY COOPERATE AND PARTICIPATE, REASONABLY AND IN GOOD
    7  FAITH, IN THE QUALITY ASSURANCE AND  PEER  REVIEW  PROGRAMS  ACTIVITIES,
    8  REQUIREMENTS  AND  PROCEDURES  COVERED  BY  SECTION TWENTY-EIGHT HUNDRED
    9  FIVE-J OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH LAW.
   10    S 3. Subdivision 1 of section 2805-k of  the  public  health  law,  as
   11  amended  by chapter 485 of the laws of 1986, paragraph (f) as amended by
   12  chapter 477 of the laws of 2008 and paragraph (g) as relettered by chap-
   13  ter 786 of the laws of 1992, is amended to read as follows:
   14    1. Prior to granting or renewing professional  privileges  or  associ-
   15  ation  of  any  physician,  dentist or podiatrist or hiring a physician,
   16  dentist or podiatrist, a hospital or facility approved pursuant to  this
   17  article  shall request from the physician, dentist or podiatrist and the
   18  physician, dentist or  podiatrist  shall  be  required  to  provide  the
   19  following information:
   20    (a)  The  name of any hospital or facility with or at which the physi-
   21  cian, dentist or podiatrist had  or  has  any  association,  employment,
   22  privileges or practice;
   23    (b)  Where  such  association,  employment,  privilege or practice was
   24  discontinued, the reasons for its discontinuation;
   25    (c) Any pending professional medical, dental or  podiatric  misconduct
   26  proceedings  or any pending medical malpractice actions in this state or
   27  another state, the substance of the allegations in such  proceedings  or
   28  actions,  and  any additional information concerning such proceedings or
   29  actions as the physician, dentist or podiatrist may deem appropriate;
   30    (d) The substance of the findings in such actions or  proceedings  and
   31  any additional information concerning such actions or proceedings as the
   32  physician, dentist or podiatrist may deem appropriate;
   33    (e)  A waiver by the physician, dentist or podiatrist of any confiden-
   34  tiality provisions concerning the information required to be provided to
   35  hospitals pursuant to this subdivision; [and]
   36    (f) Documentation  that  the  physician,  dentist  or  podiatrist  has
   37  completed the course work or training as mandated by section two hundred
   38  thirty-nine  of this chapter or section six thousand five hundred five-b
   39  of the education law. A hospital or facility shall not  grant  or  renew
   40  professional  privileges  or  association  to  a  physician, dentist, or
   41  podiatrist who has not completed such course work or training[.];
   42    (g) DOCUMENTATION THAT THE PHYSICIAN, DENTIST OR PODIATRIST AGREES  TO
   43  FULL,  GOOD FAITH COOPERATION AND PARTICIPATION IN ANY PEER REVIEW PROC-
   44  ESS, AND TERMINATION OF ALL PRIVILEGES, INCLUDING  EMPLOYMENT,  IF  SUCH
   45  PHYSICIAN,  DENTIST  OR  PODIATRIST FAILS TO FULLY COOPERATE AND PARTIC-
   46  IPATE; AND
   47    (H) A verification by the physician, dentist or  podiatrist  that  the
   48  information provided by the physician, dentist or podiatrist is true and
   49  accurate.
   50    S  4. This act shall take effect on the first of January next succeed-
   51  ing the date on which it shall have become a law.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the public health law and the education law, in relation to full and good faith participation in peer review activities
